thread.title: DraftKings, FanDuel Are Uber to casinos eyeing sports bets
thread.title_full: DraftKings, FanDuel Are Uber to casinos eyeing sports bets

author:
Christopher Palmeri
Bloomberg News
title: DraftKings, FanDuel Are Uber to casinos eyeing sports bets
text:
DraftKings, FanDuel Are Uber to casinos eyeing sports bets 
Devlin D’Zmura, a news manager at DraftKings, a daily fantasy sports company, works Sept. 9 on his laptop in Boston. The daily fantasy sports industry is a growing business that’s leaving out major players — like Las Vegas casinos. Associated Press file photo Posted: Friday, October 2, 2015 11:39 pm | Updated: 11:45 pm, Fri Oct 2, 2015. Bloomberg News SantaFeNewMexican.com | 0 comments 
At the casino industry’s biggest trade show this week in Las Vegas, Nev., the hottest topic is a growing business that’s left major players like MGM Resorts International out of the action: fantasy sports. 
The two leaders, DraftKings Inc. and FanDuel Inc., raised a total of $575 million in July from investors including KKR & Co., 21st Century Fox Inc. and Major League Baseball to attract players to games that pay out millions of dollars in cash prizes in daily contests. Casino executives interviewed during the G2E Global Gaming Expo said the murky legal status of fantasy sports and rules set down by state authorities prevent the companies from joining in.
